verses.kjv: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem:
verses.ct: Manasseh became king at the age of 12, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 55 years.

verses.kjv: But did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, like unto the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD had cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's sight, following the disgusting practices of the nations that the LORD had driven out ahead of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down, and he reared up altars for Baalim, and made groves, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
verses.ct: He rebuilt the worship sites on hilltops that his father Hezekiah had torn down. He set up altars to the Baals, constructed Asherah poles, and bowed down to all the stars and planets, worshiping them.

verses.kjv: Also he built altars in the house of the LORD, whereof the LORD had said, In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
verses.ct: He also constructed altars inside the LORD's temple — the very place where the LORD had declared, 'My name will be in Jerusalem forever.'

verses.kjv: And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: He built altars to all the stars and planets in both courtyards of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: And he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom: also he observed times, and used enchantments, and used witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: He sacrificed his own children in the fire in the Valley of Ben Hinnom. He practiced fortune-telling, sorcery, and witchcraft, and consulted mediums and spiritists. He committed an enormous amount of evil in the LORD's sight, provoking his anger.

verses.kjv: And he set a carved image, the idol which he had made, in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
verses.ct: He placed a carved idol that he had made right inside God's temple — the place about which God had told David and his son Solomon, 'In this temple and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will establish my name forever.

verses.kjv: Neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from out of the land which I have appointed for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
verses.ct: I will never again displace Israel from the land I set aside for your ancestors — as long as they are careful to obey everything I commanded them through Moses: the entire law, the regulations, and the rules.'

verses.kjv: So Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err, and to do worse than the heathen, whom the LORD had destroyed before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But Manasseh led Judah and the people of Jerusalem so far astray that they behaved even worse than the nations the LORD had wiped out ahead of the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake to Manasseh, and to his people: but they would not hearken.
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Manasseh and his people, but they refused to listen.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the LORD brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria, which took Manasseh among the thorns, and bound him with fetters, and carried him to Babylon.
verses.ct: So the LORD sent the army commanders of the king of Assyria against them. They captured Manasseh with hooks, bound him in bronze chains, and took him away to Babylon.

verses.kjv: And when he was in affliction, he besought the LORD his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers,
verses.ct: In his suffering, he pleaded with the LORD his God and deeply humbled himself before the God of his ancestors.

verses.kjv: And prayed unto him: and he was intreated of him, and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the LORD he was God.
verses.ct: When he prayed, God was moved by his plea and heard his request, bringing him back to Jerusalem and restoring his kingdom. That's when Manasseh recognized that the LORD truly is God.

verses.kjv: Now after this he built a wall without the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entering in at the fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.
verses.ct: After this, he constructed an outer wall for the City of David on the west side of the Gihon spring in the valley, extending to the entrance of the Fish Gate. It encircled the hill of Ophel, and he built it to a tremendous height. He also stationed military commanders in every fortified city throughout Judah.

verses.kjv: And he took away the strange gods, and the idol out of the house of the LORD, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the LORD, and in Jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.
verses.ct: He removed the foreign gods and the idol from the LORD's temple, along with all the altars he had built on the temple hill and throughout Jerusalem, and threw them outside the city.

verses.kjv: And he repaired the altar of the LORD, and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings, and commanded Judah to serve the LORD God of Israel.
verses.ct: Then he restored the LORD's altar and offered fellowship offerings and thanksgiving offerings on it. He ordered the people of Judah to worship the LORD, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places, yet unto the LORD their God only.
verses.ct: However, the people continued to offer sacrifices at the hilltop worship sites, though only to the LORD their God.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and his prayer unto his God, and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of the LORD God of Israel, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: The rest of what Manasseh did, including his prayer to his God and the messages the prophets delivered to him in the name of the LORD, the God of Israel — all of this is recorded in the official records of the kings of Israel.

verses.kjv: His prayer also, and how God was intreated of him, and all his sins, and his trespass, and the places wherein he built high places, and set up groves and graven images, before he was humbled: behold, they are written among the sayings of the seers.
verses.ct: His prayer, how God responded to his plea, all his sins and unfaithfulness, the locations where he built hilltop worship sites and set up Asherah poles and carved idols before he humbled himself — all of this is recorded in the writings of the prophets.

verses.kjv: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Manasseh died and joined his ancestors, and they buried him in his own palace. His son Amon became king after him.

verses.kjv: Amon was two and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned two years in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Amon was 22 years old when he became king, and he ruled in Jerusalem for 2 years.

verses.kjv: But he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as did Manasseh his father: for Amon sacrificed unto all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made, and served them;
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the LORD's sight, just as his father Manasseh had done. Amon offered sacrifices to all the carved idols that his father Manasseh had made and worshiped them.

verses.kjv: And humbled not himself before the LORD, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.
verses.ct: Unlike his father Manasseh, he never humbled himself before the LORD. Instead, Amon's guilt only increased over time.

verses.kjv: And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house.
verses.ct: His own officials plotted against him and killed him in his palace.

verses.kjv: But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
verses.ct: But the common people of the land killed everyone who had conspired against King Amon, and they made his son Josiah king in his place.
